00002 * $Id$          rs485_slave.c                   2010-05-21

00027 #include "lpc17xx_uart.h"
00028 #include "lpc17xx_libcfg.h"

00031 /* Example group ----------------------------------------------------------- */
00037 /************************** PRIVATE DEFINITIONS *************************/
00038 /*
00039  * These following defines can be modified:
00040  * - RECEIVER_ALWAYS_EN (0/1)
00041  * - AUTO_SLVADDR_DETECT (0/1) in case RECEIVER_ALWAYS_EN is set to 0
00042  */
00043 
00044 /* Receiver always be enabled to receive any data frame on RS485 bus,
00045  * regardless that frame is data frame or slave address frame (9-bit).
00046  * - When receiving a data frame, slave will display that data frame content
00047  * via UART0.
00048  * - When receiving a slave address frame (9bit mode), line error interrupt
00049  * - 0: Receiver is not always enabled, only slave address frame can trigger
00050  * an interrupt event to allow slave handle.
00051  * - 1: Receiver always be enabled */
00052 #define RECEIVER_ALWAYS_EN      0
00053 
00054 
00055 #if (RECEIVER_ALWAYS_EN == 0)
00056 /* Enable/Disable Auto Slave Address Detection
00057  * - In case of '0': any received data bytes will be ignored and will not
00058  * be stored in the RXFIFO. When an address byte is detected (parity bit
00059  * = '1') it will be placed into the RXFIFO and an Rx Data Ready Interrupt
00060  * will be generated. The interrupt handler can then read the address byte
00061  * and decide whether or not to enable the receiver to accept the following data.
00062  * - In case of '1': any received byte will be discarded if it is either a
00063  * data byte OR an address byte which fails to match the slave address configured
00064  * when initializing RS485. When a matching address character is detected it will
00065  * be pushed onto the RXFIFO along with the parity bit, and the receiver will
00066  * be automatically enabled (RS485CTRL bit 1 will be cleared by hardware).
00067  * The receiver will also generate an Rx Data Ready Interrupt */
00068 #define AUTO_SLVADDR_DETECT 1
00069 #define SLAVE_ADDR 'A'
00070 #endif
00071 
00072 /* buffer size definition */
00073 #define UART_RING_BUFSIZE 256
00074 
00075 /* Buf mask */
00076 #define __BUF_MASK (UART_RING_BUFSIZE-1)
00077 /* Check buf is full or not */
00078 #define __BUF_IS_FULL(head, tail) ((tail&__BUF_MASK)==((head+1)&__BUF_MASK))
00079 /* Check buf will be full in next receiving or not */
00080 #define __BUF_WILL_FULL(head, tail) ((tail&__BUF_MASK)==((head+2)&__BUF_MASK))
00081 /* Check buf is empty */
00082 #define __BUF_IS_EMPTY(head, tail) ((head&__BUF_MASK)==(tail&__BUF_MASK))
00083 /* Reset buf */
00084 #define __BUF_RESET(bufidx)     (bufidx=0)
00085 #define __BUF_INCR(bufidx)      (bufidx=(bufidx+1)&__BUF_MASK)
00086 
00087 /************************** PRIVATE TYPES *************************/
00089 typedef struct
00090 {
00091     __IO uint32_t tx_head;                
00092     __IO uint32_t tx_tail;                
00093     __IO uint32_t rx_head;                
00094     __IO uint32_t rx_tail;                
00095     __IO uint8_t  tx[UART_RING_BUFSIZE];  
00096     __IO uint8_t  rx[UART_RING_BUFSIZE];  
00097 } UART_RING_BUFFER_T;
00098

00100 #if (RECEIVER_ALWAYS_EN)
00101 uint8_t menu1[] =
00102 "Hello NXP Semiconductors \n\r" \
00103 "RS485 demo in Slave mode \n\r" \
00104 "Slave's Receiver always enabled \n\r";
00105 #else
00106 #if (AUTO_SLVADDR_DETECT == 0)
00107 uint8_t menu1[] =
00108 "Hello NXP Semiconductors \n\r" \
00109 "RS485 demo in Slave mode \n\r" \
00110 "Slave's Receiver is not always enabled - Auto Address Detection is disabled\n\r";
00111 #else
00112 uint8_t menu1[] =
00113 "Hello NXP Semiconductors \n\r" \
00114 "RS485 demo in Slave mode \n\r" \
00115 "Slave's Receiver is not always enabled - Auto Address Detection is enabled\n\r";
00116 #endif
00117 #endif
00118 
00119 uint8_t send_msg[] = "Sending... \n\r";
00120 uint8_t recv_msg[] = "Receive: ";
00121 uint8_t p_err_menu[] = "Parity error";
00122 uint8_t addr_menu[] = " - Slv Addr Frm received\n\r";
00123 uint8_t addr_acc[] = " - Slave Addr accepted\n\r";
00124 uint8_t addr_una[] = " - Slave Addr unaccepted\n\r";
00125 uint8_t addr_auto[] = "Slave Addr detected!\n\r";
00126 uint8_t f_err_menu[] = "Frame error \n\r";
00127 uint8_t nextline[] = "\n\r";
00128 
00129 uint8_t ack_msg[] = "ACK";
00130 uint8_t terminator = 13;

00133 UART_RING_BUFFER_T rb;

00143 /*----------------- INTERRUPT SERVICE ROUTINES --------------------------*/
00144 /*********************************************************************/
00149 void UART1_IRQHandler(void)
00150 {
00151         // Call Standard UART 0 interrupt handler
00152         uint32_t intsrc, tmp, tmp1;
00153 
00154         /* Determine the interrupt source */
00155         intsrc = UART_GetIntId(LPC_UART0);
00156         tmp = intsrc & UART_IIR_INTID_MASK;
00157 
00158         // Receive Line Status
00159         if (tmp == UART_IIR_INTID_RLS){
00160                 // Check line status
00161                 tmp1 = UART_GetLineStatus(LPC_UART0);
00162                 // Mask out the Receive Ready and Transmit Holding empty status
00163                 tmp1 &= (UART_LSR_OE | UART_LSR_PE | UART_LSR_FE \
00164                                 | UART_LSR_BI | UART_LSR_RXFE);
00165                 // If any error exist
00166                 if (tmp1) {
00167                         UART_IntErr(tmp1);
00168                 }
00169         }
00170 
00171         // Receive Data Available or Character time-out
00172         if ((tmp == UART_IIR_INTID_RDA) || (tmp == UART_IIR_INTID_CTI)){
00173                 UART_IntReceive();
00174         }
00175 }
00176 
00177 
00178 /********************************************************************/
00183 void UART_IntReceive(void)
00184 {
00185 
00186 #if (RECEIVER_ALWAYS_EN)
00187         uint8_t tmpc;
00188         uint32_t rLen;
00189 
00190         while(1){
00191                 // Call UART read function in UART driver
00192                 rLen = UART_Receive((LPC_UART_TypeDef *)LPC_UART1, &tmpc, 1, NONE_BLOCKING);
00193                 // If data received
00194                 if (rLen){
00195                         /* Check if buffer is more space
00196                          * If no more space, remaining character will be trimmed out
00197                          */
00198                         if (!__BUF_IS_FULL(rb.rx_head,rb.rx_tail)){
00199                                 rb.rx[rb.rx_head] = tmpc;
00200                                 __BUF_INCR(rb.rx_head);
00201                         }
00202                 }
00203                 // no more data
00204                 else {
00205                         break;
00206                 }
00207         }
00208 #else
00209 #if (AUTO_SLVADDR_DETECT == 0)
00210 
00211         uint8_t tmpc;
00212         uint32_t rLen;
00213 
00214         while(1){
00215                 // Call UART read function in UART driver
00216                 rLen = UART_Receive((UART_TypeDef *)UART1, &tmpc, 1, NONE_BLOCKING);
00217                 // If data received
00218                 if (rLen){
00219                         /* Check if buffer is more space
00220                          * If no more space, remaining character will be trimmed out
00221                          */
00222                         if (!__BUF_IS_FULL(rb.rx_head,rb.rx_tail)){
00223                                 rb.rx[rb.rx_head] = tmpc;
00224                                 __BUF_INCR(rb.rx_head);
00225                         }
00226                 }
00227                 // no more data
00228                 else {
00229                         break;
00230                 }
00231         }
00232 #else
00233 
00234         uint8_t tmpc;
00235         uint32_t rLen;
00236 
00237         while(1){
00238                 // Call UART read function in UART driver
00239                 rLen = UART_Receive((LPC_UART_TypeDef *)LPC_UART1, &tmpc, 1, NONE_BLOCKING);
00240                 // If data received
00241                 if (rLen){
00242                         /* Check if buffer is more space
00243                          * If no more space, remaining character will be trimmed out
00244                          */
00245                         if (!__BUF_IS_FULL(rb.rx_head,rb.rx_tail)){
00246                                 rb.rx[rb.rx_head] = tmpc;
00247                                 __BUF_INCR(rb.rx_head);
00248                         }
00249                 }
00250                 // no more data
00251                 else {
00252                         break;
00253                 }
00254         }
00255 #endif
00256 #endif
00257 }

00260 /*********************************************************************/
00265 void UART_IntErr(uint8_t bLSErrType)
00266 {
00267         uint8_t tmp;
00268 #if (RECEIVER_ALWAYS_EN)
00269         uint8_t tmpc;
00270 
00271         if (bLSErrType & UART_LSR_PE){
00272                 // Parity error means the latest frame receive is slave address frame,
00273                 // Value of slave address is read and trimmed out.
00274                 UART_Send(LPC_UART0, p_err_menu, sizeof(p_err_menu), BLOCKING);
00275                 UART_Send(LPC_UART0, addr_menu, sizeof(addr_menu), BLOCKING);
00276                 UART_Receive((LPC_UART_TypeDef *)LPC_UART1, &tmpc, 1, NONE_BLOCKING);
00277         }
00278 
00279         if (bLSErrType & UART_LSR_FE){
00280                 UART_Send(LPC_UART0, f_err_menu, sizeof(f_err_menu), BLOCKING);
00281         }
00282 #else
00283 #if (AUTO_SLVADDR_DETECT == 0)
00284         uint8_t tmp;
00285         // Check if this interrupt caused by parity error,
00286         // that means the last received frame is address frame,
00287         // if this address is matched with its own address,
00288         // continue to receive following data frame.
00289         if (bLSErrType & UART_LSR_PE){
00290                 UART_Receive((UART_TypeDef *)UART1, &tmp, 1, NONE_BLOCKING);
00291                 UART_Send(UART0, p_err_menu, sizeof(p_err_menu), BLOCKING);
00292                 if (tmp == SLAVE_ADDR){
00293                         UART_RS485ReceiverCmd(UART1, ENABLE);
00294                         UART_Send(UART0, addr_acc, sizeof(addr_acc), BLOCKING);
00295                 } else {
00296                         // Disable receiver
00297                         UART_RS485ReceiverCmd(UART1, DISABLE);
00298                         UART_Send(UART0, addr_una, sizeof(addr_una), BLOCKING);
00299                 }
00300         }
00301 #else
00302 
00303         // Check if this interrupt caused by parity error,
00304         // that means the last received frame is address frame,
00305         // if this address is matched with its own address,
00306         // continue to receive following data frame.
00307         if (bLSErrType & UART_LSR_PE){
00308                 UART_Receive((LPC_UART_TypeDef *)LPC_UART1, &tmp, 1, NONE_BLOCKING);
00309                 UART_Send(LPC_UART0, addr_auto, sizeof(addr_auto), BLOCKING);
00310         }
00311 #endif
00312 #endif
00313 }
00314 
00315 /*-------------------------PRIVATE FUNCTIONS------------------------------*/
00316 /*********************************************************************/
00324 uint32_t UARTReceive(LPC_UART_TypeDef *UARTPort, uint8_t *rxbuf, uint8_t buflen)
00325 {
00326     uint8_t *data = (uint8_t *) rxbuf;
00327     uint32_t bytes = 0;
00328 
00329         /* Temporarily lock out UART receive interrupts during this
00330            read so the UART receive interrupt won't cause problems
00331            with the index values */
00332         UART_IntConfig(UARTPort, UART_INTCFG_RBR, DISABLE);
00333 
00334         /* Loop until receive buffer ring is empty or
00335                 until max_bytes expires */
00336         while ((buflen > 0) && (!(__BUF_IS_EMPTY(rb.rx_head, rb.rx_tail))))
00337         {
00338                 /* Read data from ring buffer into user buffer */
00339                 *data = rb.rx[rb.rx_tail];
00340                 data++;
00341 
00342                 /* Update tail pointer */
00343                 __BUF_INCR(rb.rx_tail);
00344 
00345                 /* Increment data count and decrement buffer size count */
00346                 bytes++;
00347                 buflen--;
00348         }
00349 
00350         /* Re-enable UART interrupts */
00351         UART_IntConfig(UARTPort, UART_INTCFG_RBR, ENABLE);
00352 
00353     return bytes;
00354 }
00355 
00356 /*********************************************************************/
00361 void print_menu(void)
00362 {
00363         UART_Send(LPC_UART0, menu1, sizeof(menu1), BLOCKING);
00364 }
00365 
00366 
00367 /*-------------------------MAIN FUNCTION------------------------------*/
00368 /*********************************************************************/
00373 int c_entry(void)
00374 {
00375         // UART Configuration structure variable
00376         UART_CFG_Type UARTConfigStruct;
00377         // UART FIFO configuration Struct variable
00378         UART_FIFO_CFG_Type UARTFIFOConfigStruct;
00379         // Pin configuration
00380         PINSEL_CFG_Type PinCfg;
00381         // RS485 configuration
00382         UART1_RS485_CTRLCFG_Type rs485cfg;
00383         uint32_t idx, len;
00384         uint8_t buffer[10];
00385         uint32_t tmp;
00386 
00387         // UART0 section ----------------------------------------------------
00388         /*
00389          * Initialize UART0 pin connect
00390          */
00391         PinCfg.Funcnum = 1;
00392         PinCfg.OpenDrain = 0;
00393         PinCfg.Pinmode = 0;
00394         PinCfg.Pinnum = 2;
00395         PinCfg.Portnum = 0;
00396         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00397         PinCfg.Pinnum = 3;
00398         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00399 
00400         /* Initialize UART Configuration parameter structure to default state:
00401          * Baudrate = 115200 bps
00402          * 8 data bit
00403          * 1 Stop bit
00404          * None parity
00405          */
00406         UART_ConfigStructInit(&UARTConfigStruct);
00407         UARTConfigStruct.Baud_rate = 115200;
00408 
00409         // Initialize UART0 peripheral with given to corresponding parameter
00410         UART_Init(LPC_UART0, &UARTConfigStruct);
00411 
00412         /* Initialize FIFOConfigStruct to default state:
00413          *                              - FIFO_DMAMode = DISABLE
00414          *                              - FIFO_Level = UART_FIFO_TRGLEV0
00415          *                              - FIFO_ResetRxBuf = ENABLE
00416          *                              - FIFO_ResetTxBuf = ENABLE
00417          *                              - FIFO_State = ENABLE
00418          */
00419         UART_FIFOConfigStructInit(&UARTFIFOConfigStruct);
00420 
00421         // Initialize FIFO for UART0 peripheral
00422         UART_FIFOConfig(LPC_UART0, &UARTFIFOConfigStruct);
00423 
00424         // Enable UART Transmit
00425         UART_TxCmd(LPC_UART0, ENABLE);
00426 
00427         // print welcome screen
00428         print_menu();
00429 
00430 
00431         // UART1 - RS485 section -------------------------------------------------
00432         /*
00433          * Initialize UART1 pin connect
00434          */
00435         PinCfg.Funcnum = 2;
00436         PinCfg.OpenDrain = 0;
00437         PinCfg.Pinmode = 0;
00438         // TXD1 - P2.0
00439         PinCfg.Pinnum = 0;
00440         PinCfg.Portnum = 2;
00441         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00442         // RXD1 - P2.1
00443         PinCfg.Pinnum = 1;
00444         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00445         // DTR1 - P2.5
00446         PinCfg.Pinnum = 5;
00447         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00448 
00449 
00450         /* Initialize UART Configuration parameter structure to default state:
00451          * Baudrate = 9600 bps
00452          * 8 data bit
00453          * 1 Stop bit
00454          * Parity: None
00455          * Note: Parity will be enabled later in UART_RS485Config() function.
00456          */
00457         UART_ConfigStructInit(&UARTConfigStruct);
00458 
00459         // Initialize UART0 peripheral with given to corresponding parameter
00460         UART_Init((LPC_UART_TypeDef *)LPC_UART1, &UARTConfigStruct);
00461 
00462         /* Initialize FIFOConfigStruct to default state:
00463          *                              - FIFO_DMAMode = DISABLE
00464          *                              - FIFO_Level = UART_FIFO_TRGLEV0
00465          *                              - FIFO_ResetRxBuf = ENABLE
00466          *                              - FIFO_ResetTxBuf = ENABLE
00467          *                              - FIFO_State = ENABLE
00468          */
00469         UART_FIFOConfigStructInit(&UARTFIFOConfigStruct);
00470 
00471         // Initialize FIFO for UART0 peripheral
00472         UART_FIFOConfig((LPC_UART_TypeDef *)LPC_UART1, &UARTFIFOConfigStruct);
00473 
00474         // Configure RS485
00475         /*
00476          * - Auto Direction in Tx/Rx driving is enabled
00477          * - Direction control pin is set to DTR1
00478          * - Direction control pole is set to "1" that means direction pin
00479          * will drive to high state before transmit data.
00480          * - Multidrop mode is enable
00481          * - Auto detect address is disabled
00482          * - Receive state is enable
00483          */
00484         rs485cfg.AutoDirCtrl_State = ENABLE;
00485         rs485cfg.DirCtrlPin = UART1_RS485_DIRCTRL_DTR;
00486         rs485cfg.DirCtrlPol_Level = SET;
00487         rs485cfg.DelayValue = 50;
00488         rs485cfg.NormalMultiDropMode_State = ENABLE;
00489 #if AUTO_SLVADDR_DETECT
00490         rs485cfg.AutoAddrDetect_State = ENABLE;
00491         rs485cfg.MatchAddrValue = SLAVE_ADDR;
00492 #else
00493         rs485cfg.AutoAddrDetect_State = DISABLE;
00494 #endif
00495 #if RECEIVER_ALWAYS_EN
00496         rs485cfg.Rx_State = ENABLE;
00497 #else
00498         rs485cfg.Rx_State = DISABLE;
00499 #endif
00500         UART_RS485Config(LPC_UART1, &rs485cfg);
00501 
00502     /* Enable UART Rx interrupt */
00503         UART_IntConfig((LPC_UART_TypeDef *)LPC_UART1, UART_INTCFG_RBR, ENABLE);
00504         /* Enable UART line status interrupt */
00505         UART_IntConfig((LPC_UART_TypeDef *)LPC_UART1, UART_INTCFG_RLS, ENABLE);
00506 
00507     /* preemption = 1, sub-priority = 1 */
00508     NVIC_SetPriority(UART1_IRQn, ((0x01<<3)|0x01));
00509         /* Enable Interrupt for UART0 channel */
00510     NVIC_EnableIRQ(UART1_IRQn);
00511 
00512         // Enable UART Transmit
00513         UART_TxCmd((LPC_UART_TypeDef *)LPC_UART1, ENABLE);
00514 
00515         // for testing...
00516         while (1){
00517                 len = 0;
00518                 while (len == 0)
00519                 {
00520                         len = UARTReceive((LPC_UART_TypeDef *)LPC_UART1, buffer, sizeof(buffer));
00521                 }
00522 
00523                 /* Got some data */
00524                 idx = 0;
00525                 while (idx < len)
00526                 {
00527                         if (buffer[idx] == 13){
00528                                 for (tmp = 0; tmp < 1000000; tmp++);
00529                                 UART_RS485SendData(LPC_UART1, ack_msg, sizeof(ack_msg));
00530                                 UART_Send(LPC_UART0, nextline, sizeof(nextline), BLOCKING);
00531                                 UART_RS485SendData(LPC_UART1, &terminator, 1);
00532                         } else {
00533                                 /* Echo it back */
00534                                 UART_Send(LPC_UART0, &buffer[idx], 1, BLOCKING);
00535                         }
00536                         idx++;
00537                 }
00538         }
00539 
00540     return 1;
00541 }
00542 
00543 /* With ARM and GHS toolsets, the entry point is main() - this will
00544    allow the linker to generate wrapper code to setup stacks, allocate
00545    heap area, and initialize and copy code and data segments. For GNU
00546    toolsets, the entry point is through __start() in the crt0_gnu.asm
00547    file, and that startup code will setup stacks and data */
00548 int main(void)
00549 {
00550     return c_entry();
00551 }

00554 #ifdef  DEBUG
00555 /*******************************************************************************
00556 * @brief                Reports the name of the source file and the source line number
00557 *                               where the CHECK_PARAM error has occurred.
00558 * @param[in]    file Pointer to the source file name
00559 * @param[in]    line assert_param error line source number
00560 * @return               None
00561 *******************************************************************************/
00562 void check_failed(uint8_t *file, uint32_t line)
00563 {
00564         /* User can add his own implementation to report the file name and line number,
00565          ex: printf("Wrong parameters value: file %s on line %d\r\n", file, line) */
00566 
00567         /* Infinite loop */
00568         while(1);
00569 }
00570 #endif
